CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper January 18, 1947, pg. 2, reads: "Guilty? - Students of McKelvey School conduct one of their Traffic Court sessions which have been mainly responsible for the lack of accidents in Miller School, according to Dr. Louis Kalassey, principal. Intelligent instruction in the rules of traffic and precautionary measures has resulted in Miller School winning the green safety pennant. The children conduct the court with regular courtroom procedure and every legal angle is rigidly observed. The school has been including the Traffic Court in its curriculum since October. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Girls and boys wearing school crossing guard sashes gathered on stairs behind sign reading "Let's keep this flag by thinking safety, acting safely, being safe; will you help?" during traffic court at McKelvey or Miller School
